com.snap2d.gl

Class GammaTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.gl.GammaTable

  • public class GammaTable
extends Object
    Pre-calculates an internal table of gamma corrected RGB values and provides look-up functionality to apply the gamma to integer pixels.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Method Detail

      • applyGamma

        public int applyGamma(int color,
             int type,
             int[] rgbArr)
        Applies the current gamma table to the given integer pixel.
        Parameters:
        color - the integer pixel to which gamma will be applied
        type - a pixel type defined by ColorUtils
        rgbArr - optional pre-instantiated array to use when unpacking. May be null.
        Returns:
        the modified pixel value

      • applyGamma

        public int[] applyGamma(int[] argb)
        Same as applyGamma(int, int, int[]) but uses the separate ARGB values stored in the given array.
        Parameters:
        argb -
        Returns:

      • applyGamma

        public int applyGamma(int val)
        Applies gamma correction to a single ARGB component value.

        Note: Value must be within valid color range (0-255) or ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception will be thrown by the VM.
        Parameters:
        val -
        Returns:
        the gamma modified color component

      • setGamma

        public void setGamma(float gamma)
        Sets the gamma and rebuilds the internal gamma table. The passed value should be >= 0.0 specifying how much to darken or brighten the image, where 1.0 has no change, < 1 is darker, and > 1 is brighter.

        This method MAY consume noticeable time in the calling thread from rebuilding the gamma table.
        Parameters:
        gamma - the new gamma value

      • getGamma

        public float getGamma()

      • getTable

        public int[] getTable()
        Returns:
        a copy of the pre-calculated gamma values array.
